title: Have high-level requirements been developed?
description: Have high-level requirements been developed?

title: Have derived high-level requirements been defined and provided to the System Safety Assessment Process?
description: Have derived high-level requirements been defined and provided to the System Safety Assessment Process?

title: When a Specification Model expresses high level requirements, are all model elements that do not represent software requirements and are not input to a subsequent development process or activity (e.g., a comment block)  identified?
description: When a Specification Model expresses high level requirements, are all model elements that do not represent software requirements and are not input to a subsequent development process or activity (e.g., a comment block)  identified?

title: Do the high-level requirements comply with system requirements?
description: Do the high-level requirements comply with system requirements?

title: Has it been independently verified that high-level requirements comply with system requirements?
description: Has it been independently verified that high-level requirements comply with system requirements?

title: Are the high-level requirements accurate and consistent? (Are they also unambiguous, sufficiently detailed and not conflicting with each other?)
description: Are the high-level requirements accurate and consistent? (Are they also unambiguous, sufficiently detailed and not conflicting with each other?)

title: Has it been independently verified that high-level requirements are accurate and consistent? (Are they also unambiguous, sufficiently detailed and not conflicting with each other?)
description: Has it been independently verified that high-level requirements are accurate and consistent? (Are they also unambiguous, sufficiently detailed and not conflicting with each other?)

title: Has the formal model been checked for consistency (i.e., the absence of conflicts)?
description: Has the formal model been checked for consistency (i.e., the absence of conflicts)?

title: Has the formal model been independently checked for consistency (i.e., the absence of conflicts)?
description: Has the formal model been independently checked for consistency (i.e., the absence of conflicts)?

title: Are high-level requirements compatible with target computer? (Has it been ensured that no conflicts exist between the high-level requirements and the hardware/software features of the target computer, especially, system response times and input/output hardware?)
description: Are high-level requirements compatible with target computer? (Has it been ensured that no conflicts exist between the high-level requirements and the hardware/software features of the target computer, especially, system response times and input/output hardware?)

title: Can each high-level requirement be verified?
description: Can each high-level requirement be verified?

title: Do high-level requirements conform to standards? (Were deviations from the standards justified?)
description: Do high-level requirements conform to standards? (Were deviations from the standards justified?)

title: Do high-level requirements expressed as a model conform to Software Model Standards?  (Were deviations from the standards justified?)
description: Do high-level requirements expressed as a model conform to Software Model Standards?  (Were deviations from the standards justified?)

title: Does the Trace Data demonstrate a bi-directional associations between high-level requirements and system requirements allocated to software?
description: Does the Trace Data demonstrate a bi-directional associations between high-level requirements and system requirements allocated to software?

title: Are algorithms accurate? Has algorithm behavior been verified (especially in the area of discontinuities)?
description: Are algorithms accurate? Has algorithm behavior been verified (especially in the area of discontinuities)?

title: Has it been independently verified that algorithms are accurate and their behavior is correct?
description: Has it been independently verified that algorithms are accurate and their behavior is correct?

title: Are formal analysis cases and procedures correct and all assumptions justified?
description: Are formal analysis cases and procedures correct and all assumptions justified?

title: Are formal analysis results correct and discrepancies between actual and expected results explained?
description: Are formal analysis results correct and discrepancies between actual and expected results explained?

title: Is requirements formalization correct?
description: Is requirements formalization correct?

title: Is the formal method correctly defined, justified and appropriate?
description: Is the formal method correctly defined, justified and appropriate?

title: Have requirements-related configuration items been identified?
description: Have requirements-related configuration items been identified?

title: Have requirements-related baselines and traceability been established?
description: Have requirements-related baselines and traceability been established?

title: Has problem reporting been established for requirements related items?
description: Has problem reporting been established for requirements related items?

title: Has change control been established for requirements related items?
description: Has change control been established for requirements related items?

title: Has change review been established for requirements related items?
description: Has change review been established for requirements related items?

title: Has configuration status accounting been established for requirements related items?
description: Has configuration status accounting been established for requirements related items?

title: Have the system functional and interface requirements that are allocated to software been analyzed for ambiguities, inconsistencies and undefined conditions?
description: Have the system functional and interface requirements that are allocated to software been analyzed for ambiguities, inconsistencies and undefined conditions?

title: Have inputs to the software requirements process detected as inadequate or incorrect been reported as feedback to the input source processes for clarification correction?
description: Have inputs to the software requirements process detected as inadequate or incorrect been reported as feedback to the input source processes for clarification correction?

title: Has each system requirement that is allocated to software been specified in the high-level requirements?
description: Has each system requirement that is allocated to software been specified in the high-level requirements?

title: Have high-level requirements that address system requirements allocated to software to preclude system hazards  been defined?
description: Have high-level requirements that address system requirements allocated to software to preclude system hazards  been defined?

title: Are the high-level requirements stated in quantitative terms with tolerances where applicable?
description: Are the high-level requirements stated in quantitative terms with tolerances where applicable?

title: Has it been assured that high-level requirements do NOT describe design or verification detail except for specified and justified design constraints?
description: Has it been assured that high-level requirements do NOT describe design or verification detail except for specified and justified design constraints?

title: Have derived requirements and their reason for existence been defined?
description: Have derived requirements and their reason for existence been defined?

title: Do the high level requirements describe how parameter data items (if planned) are used by the software (including structure, attributes and value of each element?
description: Do the high level requirements describe how parameter data items (if planned) are used by the software (including structure, attributes and value of each element?

title: Are all model elements categorized as per the Software Model Standards (i.e. model elements that represent high-level requirements including derived requirements and those elements that don't)?
description: Are all model elements categorized as per the Software Model Standards (i.e. model elements that represent high-level requirements including derived requirements and those elements that don't)?

title: Are the high-level requirements detailed enough to enable development and verification of the Design Model?
description: Are the high-level requirements detailed enough to enable development and verification of the Design Model?

title: Do the high-level requirements  provide a functional description of the software functionality?
description: Do the high-level requirements  provide a functional description of the software functionality?

title: Have the planned transition criteria for entering the Software Design Process as identified in the Software Development Plan been satisfied?
description: Have the planned transition criteria for entering the Software Design Process as identified in the Software Development Plan been satisfied?
